title: Taiwan lowers Typhoon Ragasa death toll to 14; China starts cleanup
summary: The weakened storm remains a rain threat to Vietnam and other parts of Southeast Asia.

title: Israel in Lebanon
summary: Israeli military action in Lebanon has been described as "limited, localised and targeted". But what does that mean?

title: Video: Drone activity shuts down Denmark’s Aalborg airport
summary: Video shows a low-flying object near Denmark’s Aalborg airport which was closed to civilian and military flights.

title: Colombia’s cocaine crisis
summary: The struggle to defeat armed groups.

title: Italy, Spain send navy ships to protect Gaza flotilla after drone attacks
summary: Italy and Spain intervene to ensure Gaza flotilla's safety in the Mediterranean after drones drop 'flashbang' devices.

title: LIVE: Israel bombs family home in Gaza with children among 11 killed
summary: Attacks continue in early hours, with Israel's army targeting central and southern Gaza as global condemnation rises.

title: ‘Bloodiest day’: How Gen-Z protest wave hit India’s Ladakh, killing four
summary: Protesters, until now peaceful, have been demanding statehood and special protections for the region bordering China.

title: Earthquake measuring at least magnitude 6.1 rocks Venezuela
summary: Tremors were felt in several states in Venezuela, including the capital Caracas, and over the border in Colombia.

title: Trump demands investigation over escalator, teleprompter ‘sabotage’ at UN
summary: US president says Secret Service is investigating 'three very sinister events' at UN headquarters in New York.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,309
summary: Here are the key events on day 1,309 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: China’s new climate target branded ‘disappointing’, ‘underwhelming’
summary: Pledge to cut emissions by 7-10 percent does not go far enough, though renewables rollout a cause for hope, experts say.

title: Indonesia’s thrifty window shoppers cast doubt on economic success story
summary: 'Rohana' and 'Rojali' are the latest internet buzzwords to describe Indonesians visiting malls to do anything but spend.

title: Syrie : à l'ONU, al-Charaa promet de poursuivre tous ceux "impliqués dans le bain de sang"
summary: Le nouveau président syrien, Ahmad al-Charaa, a promis, mercredi, à l'ONU, d'éradiquer le sectarisme dans son pays et de traduire en justice toutes les personnes "impliquées dans le bain de sang" que subit la Syrie.

title: Israël : la cité balnéaire d'Eilat touchée par un drone tiré du Yémen, au moins 20 blessés
summary: Un drone tiré du Yémen a touché, mercredi en fin d'après-midi, la cité balnéaire d'Eilat, au bord de la mer Rouge, à l'extrême sud d'Israël, a annoncé l'armée, les secours faisant état d'au moins 20 blessés, dont deux grièvement.

title: Donald Trump propose un nouveau plan de paix pour Gaza aux pays de la région
summary: Donald Trump a présenté aux dirigeants de plusieurs pays du Moyen-Orient un plan de paix en 21 points pour le Proche-Orient et la bande de Gaza, a déclaré mercredi son émissaire spécial, se disant confiant en une "sorte de percée" dans les prochains jours. Pendant ce temps-là, l'armée israélienne intensifie encore son offensive, qui a fait mercredi des dizaines de morts.

title: La flottille pour Gaza dénonce une nouvelle attaque de drones au large de la Grèce
summary: La flottille humanitaire pour Gaza s'est dite ciblée dans la nuit de mardi à mercredi par une nouvelle attaque de drones alors qu'elle naviguait au sud-ouest de la Crète. L'Italie a annoncé l'envoi d'une frégate militaire pour "d'éventuelles opérations de secours".

title: Quels sont les pays qui ne reconnaissent pas la Palestine et pourquoi ?
summary: Près de 80 % des membres de l'ONU reconnaissent désormais l'État de Palestine, dont la France depuis lundi. Mais près de 40 États rejettent cette idée, surtout pour des raisons de loyauté envers les États-Unis. Tour du monde des oppositions.

title: Palestine : une reconnaissance, quelles avancées ? Parlons-en avec A. Corpet, B. Nabli et J. Soufi
summary: Après les mots du président Emmanuel Macron à la tribune des Nations unies, que change cette reconnaissance pour les Palestiniens et Palestiniennes ? Peut-elle influer sur le court de la guerre qui se poursuit à Gaza ou sur la colonisation qui va en s'accélérant ? Quelle marge de manœuvre face à un gouvernement israélien, soutenu par les États-Unis, qui affirme, lui, qu'un Etat palestinien ne verra jamais le jour ?

title: En images : l'intensification de la colonisation en Cisjordanie occupée
summary: En Cisjordanie occupée, le gouvernement israélien a accéléré ses projets de colonisation sur un territoire de plus en plus morcelé. De Jérusalem-Est à Naplouse, les envoyés spéciaux de France 24 décrivent l'impact des colonies israéliennes sur la vie quotidienne des Palestiniens.

title: La reconnaissance de l'État palestinien, un non-évènement pour les habitants de Ramallah
summary: En Cisjordanie occupée, les habitants n'expriment aucun enthousiasme quant aux retombées de la reconnaissance par la France et plusieurs autres pays de l'État de Palestine.

title: Cisjordanie, route 60 : l'incontournable "route de la mort" pour des milliers de Palestiniens
summary: En Cisjordanie, la route 60 relie entre elles les principales villes palestiniennes mais aussi les colonies israéliennes. Itinéraire incontournable pour relier Naplouse à Ramallah, les Palestiniens l'empruntent la peur au ventre, craignant la violence des colons, qui s'est déchaînée depuis les attentats du 7-Octobre. Reportage.

title: Manifestations pour Gaza en Italie : "Un monde qui raconte un pays différent"
summary: A la Une de la presse, ce mardi 23 septembre, les manifestations contre la guerre à Gaza en Italie et les réactions au discours, hier, à l’ONU, d’Emmanuel Macron sur la reconnaissance de la Palestine par la France. Une décision largement perçue comme un "défi" à l’égard des Etats-Unis. Le projet d’établir un "mur de drones" à la frontière orientale de l’UE. Et la cérémonie du Ballon d’or, hier soir.

title: État de Palestine : les Israéliens majoritairement opposés à la reconnaissance
summary: Israël avait déjà critiqué l'annonce française, avant même le discours d'Emmanuel Macron reconnaissant l'existence d'un État palestinien. Les explications de notre correspondante à Jérusalem.

title: Pour l'Autorité palestinienne, "cette reconnaissance doit être accompagnée de mesures concrètes"
summary: L'Autorité palestinienne a été l'une des premières à réagir dans la foulée du discours du président français reconnaissant l'État de Palestine à l'ONU, saluant une décision "historique et courageuse". Les explications de notre envoyée spéciale à Ramallah.

title: Au procès des femmes de l’organisation Etat islamique, Christine Allain peine à faire oublier « Mamie Kalach »
summary: Jugée pour être partie en Syrie rejoindre le groupe terroriste avec mari, enfants et petits-enfants, l’ancienne éducatrice spécialisée assure avoir été « naïve », sans renier totalement l’islam radical.

title: Par le discours d’Al-Charaa à l’ONU, la Syrie rompt avec près de soixante ans d’isolement diplomatique
summary: « La Syrie reprend la place qui lui revient parmi les nations du monde », a salué son président de transition dans son allocution, la première d’un chef d’Etat syrien aux Nations unies depuis 1967. Le djihadiste repenti au destin hors du commun a profité de sa tribune pour demander la levée des sanctions contre son pays.

title: En Ukraine, des réactions mitigées après les propos de Donald Trump à l’issue de sa rencontre avec Volodymyr Zelensky
summary: Les déclarations du président américain, mardi, en marge de l’Assemblée générale des Nations unies, ont suscité la surprise des Ukrainiens. Ils restent toutefois très prudents sur ces propos, qui n’étaient accompagnés d’aucune proposition concrète pour faire pression sur Moscou.

title: Pyongyang détient environ 2 tonnes d’uranium hautement enrichi, selon Séoul
summary: Le ministre de l’unification de la Corée du Sud, Chung Dong-young, qui cite des experts, rapporte que le stock d’uranium est enrichi « à plus de 90 % ». Une telle quantité est « suffisante pour faire un nombre considérable d’armes nucléaires », a-t-il averti.

title: En direct, guerre en Ukraine : les dernières informations
summary: Le Danemark va renforcer ses capacités de « détection et de neutralisation de drones » après le survol de quatre aéroports, dans la nuit de mercredi à jeudi, par des drones d’origine inconnue. Lundi, des drones avaient déjà survolé l’aéroport de Copenhague. La première ministre danoise n’avait pas exclu qu’il s’agisse de drones russes.

title: En direct, Gaza : Mahmoud Abbas privé de visa par les Etats-Unis, son intervention à l’Assemblée générale de l’ONU sera retransmise par vidéo
summary: Washington a refusé d’accorder des visas à près de 80 Palestiniens qui prévoyaient d’aller à New York, dont celui du dirigeant palestinien, qui doit s’exprimer dans la journée.

title: En Syrie, le poids écrasant des disparus de la guerre civile
summary: Le nombre de Syriens arrêtés par le régime d’Al-Assad pendant la guerre civile et qui n’ont pas été retrouvés par leur famille après la chute du dictateur, en décembre 2024, est estimé entre 200 000 et 300 000.

title: Assassinat de Charlie Kirk : « Les références utilisées par le suspect arrêté s’inscrivent dans la culture du LOL »
summary: Dans un entretien au « Monde », la sémiologue Laurence Allard explique comment les modes d’expression de Tyler Robinson, accusé du meurtre de l’influenceur conservateur, reflètent la prégnance des médias numériques dans la vie politique américaine.

title: La Russie reste fidèle à sa ligne : ménager Donald Trump et accuser l’Europe
summary: Vladimir Poutine n’a pas ouvertement critiqué le président américain après son revirement sur l’Ukraine, mais il prévient : la guerre continue. Quant aux incursions russes dans le ciel européen, Moscou inverse les faits et les accusations.

title: Charlie Kirk : ce que la mort de l’influenceur nous dit des Etats-Unis
summary: Le deuil du monde trumpiste après l’assassinat de Charlie Kirk a vite laissé la place à un désir de vengeance de l’administration Trump, qui a lancé une véritable chasse aux sorcières visant la « gauche radicale ». Dans ce podcast, Piotr Smolar, correspondant du « Monde » aux Etats-Unis, nous raconte comment ce meurtre cristallise les tensions politiques dans le pays.

title: Jimmy Kimmel réalise une audience record pour son retour sur ABC
summary: L’émission « Jimmy Kimmel Live! » a réuni 6,2 millions de téléspectateurs, mardi soir, soit quatre fois plus que la moyenne de la saison passée. L’humoriste avait été privé d’antenne pendant une semaine pour des propos tenus après l’assassinat de Charlie Kirk qui avaient indigné le camp trumpiste.

title: Survivre 1 358 jours dans les bois avec ses trois enfants, en échappant à la police : la cavale d’un père de famille a captivé et bouleversé la Nouvelle-Zélande
summary: Le pays se demande comment Tom Phillips, abattu début septembre par la police lors d’un braquage, a pu survivre dans un campement crasseux avec ses enfants si longtemps.

title: Israeli forces kill two aid seekers in Gaza
summary:
Israeli forces kill two aid seekers in Gaza

Israeli troops have opened fire and killed two people seeking aid in central and southern Gaza, according to Al Jazeera citing ambulance sources.

It has been reported that other people were wounded in the attacks.

title: Erdogan to meet Trump in White House
summary:
Erdogan to meet Trump in White House

President Donald Trump will hold talks with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan at the White House later on Thursday.

On Tuesday, Erdogan attended a group meeting hosted by Trump on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly, as eight Arab and Muslim leaders met to discuss the war in Gaza with the US president.

In his speech at the UN, Erdogan stressed that the war on Gaza is a genocide.  

“This is not a fight against terrorism. This is an occupation, deportation, exile, genocide and life destruction, mass destruction policy carried on by invoking the events of October the 7th.”

title: Israeli soldier killed in Gaza, says Israeli army
summary:
Israeli soldier killed in Gaza, says Israeli army

An Israeli soldier has been killed by a Palestinian sniper in Gaza City, said the Israeli military.

The soldier was identified as a 21-year-old staff sergeant from the Nahal Brigade.

He is at least the second soldier to die in combat during the Israeli ground invasion of Gaza’s largest urban centre, after an army officer was killed on Tuesday.

title: Italy to send second naval frigate to support Global Sumud Flotilla
summary:
Italy to send second naval frigate to support Global Sumud Flotilla

Italian Defence Minister Guido Crosetto said on Thursday that Rome will deploy a second naval frigate to support the Global Sumud Flotilla.

The move comes after Italy has announced yesterday it would send a warship to protect the flotilla, followed by a Spain which made a similar step.

The Global Sumud Flotilla has been subjected to at least 13 drone attacks on the late hours of Tuesday, with participants saying amount of damage is being assessed.

The flotilla said on the early hours of Thursday that sources from European governments have warned participants of escalating threats from Israel

title: David Hirst: 'An outstanding journalist we were lucky to have'
summary:
David Hirst: 'An outstanding journalist we were lucky to have'

Submitted by Victoria Brittain on Wed, 09/24/2025 - 14:43
My friend David Hirst's quiet demeanour and scholarly manner belied a fierce commitment to powerful and dispassionate reporting on the Middle East
For David Hirst, real journalism meant relentless hard work and courage in facing power as he did with many leaders in the region including late Palestinian President Yasser Arafat
On

David Hirst, who died on Monday in a hospital in France, was the outstanding journalist the Guardian was lucky enough to have, writing for the paper from the inside of the Middle East’s dramatic transformations over more than four decades. 

No western foreign correspondent has ever had his range of contacts who trusted him, or his depth of research reading. Hirst’s quiet demeanour and scholarly manner belied a fierce commitment to powerful and dispassionate reporting and analysis, despite the bitter criticism he attracted from governments across the region, most notably and relentlessly from Tel Aviv.

In the Guardian, his rare visits to the paper were an event. When he gave a talk to assembled journalists in the editor’s office, he was an unchallengeable authority, but also an obvious outsider in a small liberal world mostly preoccupied with Westminster and other parochial British interests. 

To me, there after a decade living in Saigon, Algiers and Nairobi, David personified the wider world I loved. Working with him was a privilege. To me he was a journalist of the stature of Seymour Hersh, IF Stone, Wilfred Burchett, John Pilger, some of whom I knew and all of whom taught me, as David did, that real journalism meant relentless hard work and courage in facing power. 

With his quiet manner and vivid pen, David was a scourge of the powerful. He represented everything that the 270 Palestinian journalists targeted and assassinated in Gaza by the IDF also stood for.

And even when he was periodically banned from countries such as Egypt, Syria, Saudi Arabia and Iraq, David’s sources did not dry up. Political exile of writers, artists, intellectuals and opposition figures was one of the common threads of the decades of dictators in the region which David chronicled with unsparing clarity and fearless honesty. 

Clarity and fearless honesty

Writing in the Guardian on the day of Saddam Hussein’s execution by the American occupation forces he compared him to Stalin, “he too had little of the flair or colour of other 20th century despots, little mental brilliance, less charisma, no redeeming passion or messianic fervour; he was only exceptional in the magnitude of his thuggery, the brutality, opportunism and cunning of the otherwise dull, grey apparatchik”.  

Such descriptive phrases on the towering figures of the time would stick in the mind for ever, such as on Yasser Arafat’s “notorious egotism… obsessive desire for personal control and domination… his preference for loyalty over competence”.

With his quiet manner and vivid pen, David was a scourge of the powerful

David’s friends and sources for his inimitable analysis were a patchwork of great creative people deprived of their homelands, none more than Palestinians, who peopled his adopted homeland of Lebanon.

His seminal work, published first in 1977 and twice reprinted, was The Gun and the Olive Branch, a classic, myth-breaking history from the 1880s of Israel’s treatment of the Palestinians, which appeared a decade before the revisionist history books of the Israeli New Historians, such as Professors Ilan Pappe and Avi Shlaim.

It was his great regret in his last years that he was unable to finish another revised edition, as the genocide of the past two years opened a completely new era.

David wrote for many other media outlets beyond The Guardian, including the Christian Science Monitor, the Irish Times, the St Petersburg Times in Florida, Newsday, the San Francisco Chronicle and the Daily Star in Lebanon.

His very last article, for Middle East Eye in November 2024, was a fitting apotheosis: “Is Israel going mad?”  He used the mid 1st century AD and the wars of the Zealots and the Hellenes as the historical framework for today’s religious Zionists. 

Original and honest

“It was a fundamental societal divide - not unlike the one that is taking place in Israel today - and a critical contribution to the ultimate calamity: Roman conquest, the destruction of the Temple, and the final dispersal of the Jewish people into their ‘exile’ for centuries to come,” he concluded.

Gaza genocide: Is Israel going mad?
David Hirst
Read More »

David’s  last decade was spent living happily in a village in what he liked to call, “the depths of La Douce France” where every night he and Amina, his beloved wife of three decades, watched Al Jazeera television news and analysis, which he called, “seriously good and honest”.  

Those words exactly fit David and the original and honest work that was his life. He was, he said in the last weeks, quite “reconciled” to his death. He stated: “I’ve had a long life.” It is all our loss that he is not with us to write about the genocide and existential crisis of Palestinians today; but the loss of this kind and gentle man will be felt in many more private ways than that.

The views expressed in this article belong to the author and do not necessarily reflect the editorial policy of Middle East Eye.

title: At least 15 killed in Gaza since dawn
summary:
At least 15 killed in Gaza since dawn

Medical sources in Gaza hospitals said that at least 15 people have been killed in separate Israeli attacks since the early hours of Thursday.

Meanwhile, Palestinian sources said that Israeli troops destroyed residential buildings in Al-Nafaq area north of Gaza City.

title: Netanyahu heads to US for UN speech, talks with Trump
summary:
Netanyahu heads to US for UN speech, talks with Trump

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has left on Thursday morning to the United States where he plans to make a speech at the UN general assembly meetings, and discuss with Trump “the need to complete the goals of the war”.

Netanyahu said the talks will be to: “bring back all our hostages, to defeat Hamas and to expand the circle of peace that has presented itself to us following the historic victory in Operation Rising Lion and other victories we have achieved," referring to Israel's 12-day war with Iran.

He added that in his UN speech he intends "to denounce the leaders who, instead of condemning the killers, want to give them a state in the heart of the Land of Israel. That will not happen."

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning, Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from the Israeli war on Gaza, now in its 719th day, and developments in the occupied West Bank:

  • Global Sumud Flotilla said in the early hours of Thursday that vessels are sailing at slow speeds in Greek territorial waters, reporting a moderate drone activity through out the night. It added that European Union government sources pointed at escalating threats by Israel as the Flotilla sails in international waters today.
  • The Norwegian Prime Minister described the situation in Gaza as ‘catastrophic’.
  • Sources told Al Jazeera that Israeli forces stormed the town of Qatanna, north-west of occupied Jerusalem, and began demolishing several homes on the pretext of lacking permits.
  • The Israeli military announced on Thursday the death of a sergeant in fighting in northern Gaza. 
  • Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu headed on Thursday to the United States to address the UN General Assembly in New York and hold talks with President Donald Trump.
  • A White House official said that US special envoy Steve Witkoff presented a postwar plan for Gaza on Wednesday, which includes a new dialogue between Israel and the Palestinians aimed at coexistence, during a meeting between Trump and leaders of Arab and Muslim countries.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • Israel said that at least 20 people were injured when a drone crashed and exploded in Eilat. Yemen’s Houthi group claimed responsibility for the attack.

  • Israeli forces arrested the mayor of Bruqin, west of Salfit in the West Bank, the latest in a string of arrests targeting Palestinian officials since August.

  • Multiple military raids and attacks by Israelis from illegal settlements took place across the occupied West Bank, where settlers attacked the mayor of the Beita municipality, Mahmoud Barham. 

  • A group of settlers fired at mourners of Saeed Murad al-Nasan, who was killed on Tuesday by armed settlers in the village of al-Mughayyir, north of Ramallah.  

  • A state of alert was declared on board the Global Sumud Flotilla after drones flew over it. Several countries warned their citizens on the flotilla of an imminent Israeli attack.

  • Unrwa chief Philippe Lazzarini said that Gaza has become home to the highest number of child amputees per capita worldwide. 

  • WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said that 15,600 patients in Gaza are waiting for medical evacuation to receive lifesaving care. 

  • Iran said it has obtained documents about Israel's nuclear reactor in Dimona, its weapons programs and a list of scientists involved in the country's nuclear project

  • Colombian President Gustavo Petro said that statements condemning Israel are not enough and "force is needed to confront the occupation".

  • GCC said that any aggression against a Gulf state is an aggression against all GCC countries.

  • Macron said that the fate of Palestinian civilians should not be left in the hands of Netanyahu, "for whom the release of hostages is not a priority".

title: Countries warn citizens on Gaza-bound flotilla of imminent Israeli attack
summary:
Countries warn citizens on Gaza-bound flotilla of imminent Israeli attack

Several countries on Wednesday warned their citizens on the Global Sumud Flotilla of an imminent Israeli attack, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

The flotilla declared a state of alert after drones flew over it, the report said. 

Spain on Wednesday announced that the country will dispatch a ship for possible relief, news agency AFP reported. 

The report quoted the Spanish prime minister as saying that the navy ship will assist the Global Sumud Flotilla.

Italian Defence Minister Guido Crosetto also said he had redirected an Italian navy ship to head towards the flotilla to possibly offer assistance.

Organisers of the expedition, which is attempting to carry aid to the Gaza Strip, shared footage that appears to show an explosion that detonated on one of the flotilla's vessels.

The flotilla was previously attacked by projectiles launched by drones while anchored in Tunisia on 8 and 9 September.

Bringing together more than 300 activists from 44 countries, including Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg, the civilian flotilla is the largest maritime aid convoy to head for Gaza since Israel began its genocide of Palestinians in October 2023.

title: Israeli settler attacks reported across West Bank
summary:
Israeli settler attacks reported across West Bank 

Multiple military raids and attacks by Israelis from illegal settlements took place across the occupied West Bank, Wafa news agency reported. 

Israeli settlers attacked the mayor of the Beita municipality, Mahmoud Barham, and municipal council member Jamil Dweikat in Jabal Qamas, south of Nablus. 

A group of settlers fired live bullets at mourners of Saeed Murad al-Nasan, who was killed on Tuesday by armed settlers in the village of al-Mughayyir, north of Ramallah.  

The report said that Israeli forces stormed the town of Birzeit and the village of Burham, north of Ramallah, and set up a military checkpoint.

The military also raided the village of al-Asakra, east of Bethlehem, and searched several homes.

title: Israeli forces arrest West Bank mayor
summary:
Israeli forces arrest West Bank mayor

Israeli forces on Wednesday arrested the mayor of Bruqin, west of Salfit in the West Bank, the latest in a string of arrests targeting Palestinian officials since August, according to Palestinian media.

Al Jazeera Arabic, quoting Palestinian sources, reported that Israeli forces arrested several young men along with the secretary of the Fatah movement. 

Israeli forces on Saturday had arrested Ibrahim Asi, the mayor of a northern West Bank town Qarawat Bani Hassan, near the city of Salfit. Asi was the fifth Palestinian mayor to be arrested in the occupied West Bank.

Since 23 August, Israeli forces have also detained Amin Abu Alia, the mayor of al-Mughayyir; Tayseer Abu Sneineh, mayor of Hebron; Nafiz Hammoudeh, mayor of Qubeiba and Abdul Fattah Abu Ali, mayor of Silat al-Zahr.

summary: President Pezeshkian emphasized that Iran does not seek nuclear weapons and attributed the current situation to the parties that withdrew from the JCPOA.

title: President Pezeshkian calls sanctions displeasing, affirms Iran’s unwavering resilience
summary: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian emphasized that while Iran seeks peace and stability, it will never succumb to coercion.

title: Iranian and Swiss Presidents Meet in New York
summary: President Masoud Pezeshkian, in continuation of the programs of the first day of his visit to New York, met Swiss President Karin Keller-Sutter on Wednesday.

title: Iranian and French presidents stress need for dialogue to help resolve nuclear issue
summary: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian and his French counterpart, Emmanuel Macron, underlined the need for resolving the issue of Iran's nuclear program through negotiations.

title: President Pezeshkian: Dialogue will be meaningless if snapback is enforced
summary: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian emphasized that if the snapback mechanism is triggered, negotiations would lose their significance.

title: Iran reveals sensitive data on Israeli nuclear sites, experts: Intelligence Minister
summary: Iranian Intelligence Ministry classified the strategic and sensitive information and documents related to the Israeli regime's nuclear sites and scientists it recently acquired, according to intelligence minister.

title: Ten reasons for Pezeshkian shinnig at UN
summary: The text read out by the respected President Masoud Pezeshkian at the UN was concise, comprehensive, and inspiring for several reasons, an Iranian writer and poet said.

title: Qalibaf praises Pezeshkian for prudent, firm stance at UNGA
summary: The Parliament Speaker said that President Pezeshkian conveyed the voice of the Iranian people’s “dignity and strength” to the world.

title: Representatives of anti-war movements in US meet Pezeshkian
summary: The President of the Islamic Republic of Iran met with representatives of anti-war movements in the United States on the sidelines of the 80th annual meeting of the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Brave Iranian soldiers have made enemies regret their actions against Iran: Top commander
summary: Major General Rahim Mousavi praised Iranian soldiers, saying their bravery has strengthened the nation’s defense and deterrence, forcing adversaries to regret hostile actions against the Islamic Republic.

title: Iran’s Araghchi meets French FM in over nuclear talks
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – Foreign Minister of Iran and France held talks on Iran's nuclear case on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly in New York.

title: Iran has no intention to create nuclear weapons
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – Speaking to his Finnish counterpart, the Iranian president emphasized that Iran has no intention of creating nuclear weapons and is open to transparency in this matter.

title: France reacts to attack on Global Sumud Flotilla
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – The French Foreign Ministry reacted to the recent attack on the Gaza-bound Global Sumud Flotilla.

title: Kuwait Crown Prince calls for an immediate halt to Gaza war
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – Kuwait’s Crown Prince described the ongoing events in Gaza as a genocide resulting from double standards in enforcing international law and called for an immediate halt to the conflict.

title: Tunisians protest attacks on Gaza aid flotilla
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – On Wednesday, Tunisian citizens held a demonstration to protest the targeting of the global “Sumud” flotilla aiming to break the blockade of Gaza.

title: West's mistrust in Iran stems from Israeli propaganda
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – Iran’s president told Norway’s prime minister that Tehran’s nuclear program is peaceful, adding that the Westerners' mistrust comes from misunderstandings and Israeli propaganda.

title: Washington claims ready to negotiate with Tehran
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – US special envoy Steven Witkoff claimed that Washington is ready to negotiate the recent move to reimpose sanctions on Iran.

title: Yemen hits Israeli Eilat Port with drones: Saree
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – Yemen’s military spokesman said two drones struck Eilat (Umm al-Rashrash) port in southern occupied Palestine, with Israeli defenses failing to stop the attack.

title: Iran plans to build new nuclear site 'Iran Hormuz'
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – Mohammad Eslami, Head of the Atomic Energy Organization of Iran, said the "Iran Hormuz" plant in Hormozgan, with a 5,000 MW capacity, will soon enter the design stage.

title: Syria, Ukraine restore ties
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – Syria and Ukraine restored diplomatic relations Wednesday, as Ahmed Al-Sharaa held talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on the sidelines of the 80th UN General Assembly session in New York.

title: Negotiations meaningless if snapback activated
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian says that Tehran is ready to verify the peaceful nature of its nuclear program, but if the snapback mechanism is activated, holding talks on this issue would no longer make sense.

title: 'Massive explosion' rocks southwest UK (+VIDEO)
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 25 (MNA) – Emergency services are dealing with a serious incident in Wiltshire after a "massive explosion" at a warehouse on an industrial estate.

title: بانک مرکزی ۱۱۹.۲ همت وام ازدواج و فرزندآوری به ۵۳۰ هزار نفر پرداخت کرد
